heading: 2.7.1 Paired sample t-test and Wilcoxon signed rank test
text:
Two-tailed paired t-tests conducted examine whether mean difference following groups significantly different:• Confidence
• Daily usefulness
• Increasing achievements
• Accomplishing things quickly
• Increased productivity
• Ease use
• Clear understandable interactions
• Use chatbots frequentlyThe results showed significant differences comparisons. comparison results :• Confidence- t(24) = -0.35, p = .731 (prem=1.96, postm=2.04)• Daily usefulness- V = 48.50, z = -0.27, p = .790 (prem=2.04, postm=2.12)• Increasing achievements- t(24) = -0.18, p = .857 (prem=2.28, postm=2.32)• Accomplish tasks quickly- V = 36.00, z = -0.25, p = .805 (prem=2.12, postm=2.16)• Increased productivity- V = 96.00, z = -1.51, p = .131 (prem=2.6, postm=2.24)• Ease use- V = 72.00, z = -1.32, p = .186 (prem=2.36, postm=2.12)• Clear understandable interactions- V = 101.50, z = -1.82, p = .068 (prem=2.2, postm=2.61)• Use chatbots frequently- t(24) = 0.45, p = .657 (prem=2.2, postm=2.08)predicted, sensitivity t-test meant Wilcoxon test appropriate measures. results show minor increases means , minor decreases others. results high standard deviations minority participants scoring low, explored focus group discussions.
